content: Have used this app for over a decade. By far the easiest and most efficient app for cross platform play. I proudly support the creator. Thank you!
Excellent!!
Great format

I originally bought this as it worked so well on an old iPad. Then I bought it for my windows phone several years ago, and now with an Android phone I'm happy to pay for this wonderful, never failing, simple app. All I want to do with internet chess is make a move from time to time; not interested in progression, just playing a few nice games. This is brilliant and I'm my opinion, still the best app there is for correspondence chess. I heartily recommend this app; try it.
I Should Have Given You Guys 5 Stars But Something Is Missing And Thats Cordinates Pls Add Cordinate To The Board In Your Next Update
Would be great if there was option to limit allowedmove time to 1 day. Pretty much unusable without that, despite solid UI

Been playing on the the free one for years so decided to buy it to support the developer. Best chess app for good clean competitive matches. Brilliant to play with work colleagues in non ranked but scored games. Have the chance to play against a grand master after I had the cheek to message him. I'd like to say I won but he controlled me from opening gambit. Turns out he was a professor for chess at a university in the USA. I googled him.of course.. Highly recommend this app But you knew that.üòÄ

Can be used on different devices, the interface is nice and economic. Only the slow time control 5 days/move is available. There are no arbiters, no option to complain about the opponent, however, the chat cannot be switched off and the disturbing players cannot be blocked. In the rules the use of databases and chess engines is prohibited, but the databases and textbooks are always allowed in correspondence chess. The violations are not checked as some Sergey from Karachaevsk has ELO > 6500.
Decent correspondence chess app. Play games with humans.
I think abcd.... and numbers wanted
This app is great, keep it up!

Tried this from three different devices over a couple of years. Great idea, 
but notifications don't send consistently.
replyContent: Thanks for this feedback!  I have just released an update to fix the notifications.  Give it a try and let me know if it doesn't solve the issue for you.

content: Good game
Best chess app for playing other people.  No complaints.  I use daily.

This app is really cool. You can play an unlimited amount of games at the same time and send messages back and forth with any players.  Plus you have plenty of time to reply if you have a busy schedule.  I wish the app could keep stored ALL of the games we've played. I don't see my older games. I have some great games I've lost. But if I have to choose between a 4 or 5 rating, I'd round it off to 5. Great app overall.
Very simple but effective cross platform chess game. Love it!
Would like to have the possibility to play in landscape mode.
Ok.... no customer service
Is the app down? It is broken for me and reinstalled and now unable to log in.
Glad to support you dev. This game's great and you've done well to make it work on all platforms <3

Tired of sore losers, who just offer draws when they are about to lose.  You have 5 days to move, when a draw is offered it resets their timer for another five days.  They can continue this over and over.
Great app. Having the algebraic coordinates would be a nice addition.
W≈Ça≈õciwie to czego szuka≈Çem i oczekiwa≈Çem, mo≈ºna prowadziƒá wiele rozgrywek r√≥wnocze≈õnie, graƒá z znajomymi lub gry rankingowe, polecam i wspieram autora.

The app is excellent but currently open to abuse. I currently have a game against someone who is lost but taking five days for each move, while spamming me with abusive messages on the chat. Can there be either a report feature or the option to turn off chat for a specific game?

Why do players make one move and don't for several days. Also what is point of asking for a draw u either either win lose or by default stalemate. This game is getting to be a game for lovers and babys
Using if for 3 years and this is my favourite application for playing chess.
By far, the app I use the most on my phone.

Best correspondence chess app out there. Free one is good but upgraded solely to support developer. App is great - ranked games, friendlies, make and save notes, chat if you want to. Don't get notifications on tablet (nexus 7)  it this is minor issue as also on phone. Would be good if tablet version could do landscape with notes editable next to board.
Has everything you need to enjoy playing chess with friends.
By far the most complete chess program...highly  recommend.

No problems originally, but as of late I've been receiving no notifications for when its my turn to move.  No vibration, no audiable, no chess piece on the notification bar.  I tried turning my phone off then on and tried force stopping to app.  It works sometimes but most times it doesn't.

Convinced by the free version, I bought the full version to support the developer and get rid of advertisement. It was very easy to log in with my former free account and all my previous records (ranking and games) were immediately available.  Best app for playing against humans with same level or with friends. I just wish the board would better refresh after a move. Quite often you have to get back to the menu and load the game again to refresh which is not convenient. Should it be fixed I would rate 5‚òÜ
I play daily with multiple friends and online players. Play multiple games at once.  It keeps games saved, and you can play through them again for training..

This has been the best chess application that I've found.  I spent nearly three months trying different ones, and web based gaming platforms. I love the cross-platform abilities, because I'm able to play with all my friends regardless of whether they are on android, ios, or Windows.
Really simple, perfect for playing friends online as and when. Perfect!
Simple interface, easy to find ranked games. Worth buying full version.
Could do with some extra features around remind, change and reset password but the core chess playing part is excellent.
Logged into facebook but cant retrieve friends list. Please fix this

Red Hot Pawn have an android app but it's terrible. Gameknot have a mobile site but it's really slow. By contrast Chess by Post is a  pleasure to use. I would give it 5 stars if all the content fit on my Samsung Galaxy Pocket's screen.

This used to be a great app. I love playing chess, but since 4 months ago, this app crashes constantly. I have emailed the developer, but he never responds back to my emails. Is there a chance I can get a refund?   August 14, 2014 ****update*****  after the update, it now works as before. best chess app ever
replyContent:
Hi Josue,  
Thanks for letting me know about the crashes you were experiencing.  I think I fixed the issue with the update in version 3.1.7.  Please give the update a try.
Cheers,
Jeff

content: This is a great way to play chess. I play ranked games against random people from around the world and work my way up the rankings, and also play unranked games against a group of friends for bragging rights! :-) Only problem is, I can end up playing about 5 games at once, which gets confusing - but Chess by Post has the answer to that too - you can make notes on each game, rewind through the game to see the last few moves to refresh your memory (or even all the way back to the beginning if you like!) and as if that wasn't enough, you can also use "Plan Moves" to freely take moves for both sides to try out your strategies for the rest of the game. This app has got me back into playing chess, which I haven't seriously done for decades. Also, the developer, Jeff, responded very quickly (emailed response within 45 minutes) when I had an issue. Excellent! The ads in the free version aren't intrusive, so I could easily have put up with them, but this is an app which was worth paying for, so I did.
My only wish is for it to work in landscape mode.
Suggestion: should be possible to export game to clipboard.
Needs a landscape mode and app looks terrible on note 3 and Note pro
Excellent playability,  very intuitive control so you can concentrate on playing chess!
It works. The dev is responsive. Works across platforms.  Good job, thank you.
Happy to be a supporter. Not invasive privacy wise, thanks for that!

I've noticed that notifications do not take you to the game with the updated opponent move. You have to close the app and reopen for the move to update. Pretty annoying as the free version did not have this issue. Great app nonetheless. I'm on the Galaxy S3.
If you like being verbally abused and called name in chat this might be for you.  If not AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.  I have been verbally abused by a couple of players.  I am uninstalling.

The game play itself is good. The big problem is players have 5 days to make a move. If you want to play actual games within reasonable times...don't get this. If the designer would at least give the option for reasonable time limits this app would be excellent.  I have had to open like 12 games in an effort to play through one game. I am going to search for an app that I can actually play a game on.
NO NEED TO PAY FOR SUBSCRIPTION SO THAT MAKES IT A GREAT APP.

Upgraded after I got three of my friends to play against me on the free version. Thought I would have wanted a single player AI mode but I don't miss it at all. I've found myself starting some games to strangers, which are ranked to my level. I don't have many needs and rather have a lightweight app with simple graphics, than an app that drains the battery and feels slow. The extras: rewinding the game for evaluation is very useful and I found myself using the "plan moves" feature on some occasions as well.

Perfect.  No Facebook login or twitter sharing or other silly junk.  Just a good app that does exactly what you want.  Postal chess.    One feature that would be nice to incorporate is chess 960.  Aka Fischer random.
Great app and getting better. Responsive developer.  Rapid correspondence chess. Fun stuff.

I found this on windows 8 store and bought it. Since then I've bought it for android and had three of my friends pick it up as well. Well made. Needs some tweaks to fully exploit massive screens, but totally playable as is.
Nexus 4 after latest update notifications don't work.
Works great on nexus 4 and galaxy s3
This would be a great game if it didn't crash practically every time I press a button. Almost unusable.  Running on a factory fresh ICS build, so can't imagine problem could be mine.
Exactly what I was looking for for some time!

VERY effective and to the point.  I purchased every correspondence chess app and ended up playing this one daily.  It is ideal for the avid chess player.  I would like to analyze games afterward by saving completed games to a pgn file.
Nice interface. Smooth animation. Love this.

The best and closest chess game to chess with friends. Finally I can play with my dad on android and my brother on iPhone IOS in the same app. Ratings are great and everything is just very fast and intuitive.
after update I uninstalled and reinstalled.. notifications now work on Jellybean
Great app, dev really works hard to make it perfect!
Love it, my most played game!
Very fast app...well written and non buggy

I played this game constantly for almost a year but then it quit working on my LG Optimus slider. It also quit working on my friends Optimus (non-slider version). It won't open and I get the message that it has stopped unexpectedly. Reinstalling doesn't help. I finally uninstalled it. I miss the game and I'd give it 5 stars if it kept working although it's probably just my crappy Virgin Mobile phone.

This was my #1 app on WP7. A perfectly developed application that knew how to handle foreground ui and background threads. The ingenious but subtle move system.  The dev, Jeff, is active!  I reported my main issue with the Android version, and he fixed it in 24h. Awesome! Galaxy Nexus w/ICS
